citations.narrative:
In September 2024, this facility evacuated its animals due to the Line Fire in Southern California. Although this facility has
an emergency evacuation plan for fires, the plan was not appropriately developed or followed. There was an insufficient
number of adequately trained employees on hand and available to assist with the preparation and execution of the animal
evacuation procedures considering the number and species of animals at the facility. Also, the facility where the animals
were temporarily housed was not included in the plan, and vehicle transportation for the animals was not adequately
planned for and followed. The facility did not have the appropriate vehicles readily available to transport the larger
mammals such as bears, and therefore had to utilize unplanned outside sources on short notice. Failure to develop and
follow through with an appropriate plan may have serious adverse impacts on the health and welfare of the animals. It
was noted that there were no animals injured or negatively impacted during the evacuation time period or upon return of
the animals to the home facility. The licensee must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the
humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster
(one which could reasonably be anticipated and expected to be detrimental to the good health and well-being of the
animals in their possession).
Correct from this day,10/29/2024, forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
ALEXANDRA ANDRICOS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
